clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Antimicrobial Photodynamic Therapy and Guedes-Pinto Paste for Endodontic Treatment of Deciduous Teeth
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Antimicrobial Photodynamic Therapy and Guedes-Pinto Paste for Endodontic Treatment of Deciduous Teeth - Study Protocol for a Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The elimination of pathogenic microorganisms from the root canal system is one of the main factors in order to have success in endodontic treatment. The objective of this study is to perform a randomized controlled clinical trial to compare the effectiveness of endodontic treatment in primary teeth when using Guedes-Pinto paste, with and without instrumentation of the root canals, and associated or not with antimicrobial photodynamic therapy. Forty-five necrotic primary teeth of children aged between 3 and 6 years will be selected. The teeth will be divided into three groups. In Group I, the conventional endodontic treatment (instrumentation) and filling with Guedes-Pinto paste will be performed. In Group II, the root canals will not be instrumented, only irrigated and filled with Guedes-Pinto paste. In Group III, the root canals will not be instrumented, only irrigated, photodynamic therapy will be performed and the filling will also be made with Guedes-Pinto paste. In all groups, microbiological evaluations will be made before and immediately after endodontic treatment, and clinical and radiographic evaluations will be conducted in the day, 1 month, 3 months and 6 months after treatment.

study_design_info.masking_description: The clinical, radiographic and microbiological evaluations will be made by an assessor who will not know to which group the participants belong.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Investigation of the Change in the Presence of Fistulas
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one month, 3 months and 6 months after treatment.
primary_outcome.description: In the follow-up consultations, teeth and gums will be clinically evaluated to check the presence of fistulas.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Investigation of Changes in Tooth Mobility
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one month, 3 months and 6 months after treatment.
primary_outcome.description: In the follow-up consultations, teeth will be clinically evaluated to check the presence of mobility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiographic Evaluation of the Changes in the Presence of Periapical Lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month, 3 months and 6 months after treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: In the follow-up consultations, periapical radiographs will be taken to check for the presence of periapical lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Analysis - change in colony forming units
secondary_outcome.description: All samples will be collected with three paper cones, which will be inserted into the root canal before and immediately after treatment and placed into brain heart infusion broth for culturing to allow the determination of the total number of viable bacteria. The samples will be homogenized for 3 minutes in a vortex agitator, followed by dilution in 4.5 ml of peptone water of the order of 10-6. Three 25-μl aliquots of the decimal solution will be sewn into Petri dishes with blood agar. The cultures will be incubated for 5 days at 37 °C in an 85 % nitrogen (N2), 10 % carbon dioxide (CO2) and 5 % hydrogen (H2) atmosphere obtained though the use of an anerobiosis generation system to allow the visualization of the total number of viable bacteria in CFU.

arm_group.description: In this group, the conventional endodontic treatment will be made, the canals will be irrigated and filled with Guedes-Pinto paste.
In this group,the canals will be irrigated and filled with Guedes-Pinto paste.
In this group, the canals will be irrigated, antimicrobial photodynamic therapy will be performed and the canals will be filled with Guedes-Pinto paste.

intervention.description: Convencional endodontic treatment for deciduous teeth will be conducted with surgical chemical preparation. Series of Kerr files of appropriate for each case will be selected, using an initial file and an additional two files of larger size, irrigation and aspiration with 1% sodium hypochlorite (Milton's solution) and endo PTC (Fórmula & Ação) with each change of file.
Irrigation and aspiration in the root canals with 1% sodium hypochlorite (Milton's solution).

The Therapy XT-EC (DMC ABC Medical and Dental Equipment, São Carlos, SP, Brazil) will be used for PDT, with laser emission in the red band (660 nm) and the narrow tip for the specific use of PDT in areas of difficult access. One session of PDT with the Chimiolux® methylene blue photosensitizer (Hypofarma, Belo Horizonte, MG, Brazil) at a concentration of 0.005 % will be performed in the interior of the root canal. The photosensitizer will be applied with a sterile paper cone for 3 minutes and the excess will be removed with an endodontic aspirator. The canal will be irradiated for 40 seconds, with the device previously calibrated to emit a wavelength at 660 nm, with radiant energy of 4 J and mean maximum power of 100 mW. The direct contact method will be employed.

The root canals will be filled with Guedes-Pinto Paste, which is a composite of 3 medications: Rifocort® (dermatologic ointment), camphorated paramonochlorophenol (PMCC) and iodoform. It will be prepared at the moment of use with the same proportion in volume of 3 visually identical parts, one for each of its components.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 3 to 6 years old with at least one anterior deciduous tooth with pulp necrosis in a position to be restored and at least 2/3 of the remaining root.
- Healthy patients and who did not antibiotic treatment in the previous three months.
Exclusion Criteria:
• Compromised health, primary teeth with more than one third root loss, lack of internal pathological resorption, impossibility of restoration, cases of re-treatment and crypt involvement.
